title: Brave Blossoms tackle typhoon Hagibis flood waters for training – video
text:
Rugby World Cup hosts Japan braved high waters and a sodden pitch for their captain's run at Prince Chichibu Memorial Stadium on Saturday, as Typhoon Hagibis slammed into Honshu, Japan's most populous island.

The Brave Blossoms are scheduled to face Scotland at International Stadium Yokohama on Sunday in a pivotal Pool A encounter, but Rugby World Cup organisers may yet cancel the match if it is deemed unsafe to play after the extreme weather.

A decision is due at around midnight BST / 9am Tokyo time and if the match is off, Scotland will be eliminated after Ireland's bonus-point win against Samoa.

Revealed: Typhoon contingency plan was to move matches 14 miles away
description: Japan are due to play Scotland in Yokohama on Sunday, unless Rugby World Cup organisers cancel the match after typhoon Hagibis
